Enums/BFSEvent.html#/s:13PenguinGraphs8B.abstract: When all edges from a vertex have been traversed.

Enums/VertexColor.html#/s:13PenguinGraph.name: white
Enums/VertexColor.html#/s:13PenguinGraph.abstract: white is used for unseen vertices in the graph.

Enums/VertexColor.html#/s:13PenguinGraph.name: gray
Enums/VertexColor.html#/s:13PenguinGraph.abstract: gray is used for vertices that are being processed.

Enums/VertexColor.html#/s:13PenguinGraph.name: black
Enums/VertexColor.html#/s:13PenguinGraph.abstract: black is used for vertices that have finished processing.

Enums/VertexColor.html.name: VertexColor
Enums/VertexColor.html.abstract: VertexColor is used to represent which vertices have been seen during graph searches.

Enums/GraphErrors.html.abstract: Errors that can be thrown during graph processing.

Protocols/GraphProtocol.html#/s:13Pengui.name: VertexId

Protocols/IncidenceGraph.html.name: IncidenceGraph
Protocols/IncidenceGraph.html.abstract: A graph that allows retrieval of edges from each vertex.

Protocols/BidirectionalGraph.html.name: BidirectionalGraph
Protocols/BidirectionalGraph.html.abstract: A graph that allows retrieval of edges incoming to each vertex (the “in-edges”).

Protocols/VertexListGraph.html.name: VertexListGraph
Protocols/VertexListGraph.html.abstract: A VertexListGraph is a graph that can enumerate all the vertices within it.

Protocols/EdgeListGraph.html.name: EdgeListGraph
Protocols/EdgeListGraph.html.abstract: An EdgeListGraph is a graph that can enumerate all edges within it.

Protocols/MutableGraph.html.name: MutableGraph
Protocols/MutableGraph.html.abstract: A MutableGraph can be changed via the addition and removal of edges and vertices.

Protocols/PropertyGraph.html.name: PropertyGraph
Protocols/PropertyGraph.html.abstract: A PropertyGraph stores additional information along with the graph structure.

Protocols/MutablePropertyGraph.html.name: MutablePropertyGraph
Protocols/MutablePropertyGraph.html.abstract: A MutablePropertyGraph keeps track of additional metadata for each vertex and edge.
